description: TO ELECT A SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE VOTES FOR J.G. CANNON ARE CODED 2. VOTES FOR J.S. WILLIAMS ARE CODED 1.
Issue1: Election of the Speaker of the House

description: TO PASS A HOUSE RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE RULES OF THE 57TH CONGRESS BE ADOPTED AS THE RULES OF THE 58TH CONGRESS, AND THAT THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON INDUSTRIAL ACTS AND EXPOSITION BE CONSTITUTED A STANDING COMMITTEE CONSISTING OF 15 MEMBERS, AND HAVE THE SAME JURISDICTION AS THE SELECT COMMITTEE IN THE 57TH CONGRESS.  (P. 149-1)

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION, ON H.RES. 17, THE ORDER FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1921, RELATING TO CARRYING INTO EFFECT A CONVENTION BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE REPUBLIC OF CUBA, SIGNED DECEMBER 11, 1902. (P. 254-1, 258-1)

TO PASS H.RES. 17, THE ORDER FOR CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL, H.R. 1921, RELATING TO CARRYING INTO EFFECT A CONVENTION BETWEEN THE UNITED STATE AND THE REPUBLIC OF CUBA, SIGNED DECEMBER 11, 1902.  (P. 254-1)

TO TABLE THE APPEAL OF MR. WILLIAMS FROM THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR, MADE DURING THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1921, A BILL TO CARRY INTO EFFECT A CONVENTION BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE REPUBLIC OF CUBA, SIGNED DECEMBER 11, 1902, CHAIR RULING THAT ALL INCIDENTAL QUESTIONS OF ORDER, ARISING AFTER A MOTION IS MADE TO THE PREVIOUS QUESTION AND PENDING SUCH MOTION, SHALL BE DECIDED WITHOUT DEBATE.  (P. 388-2)
TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION, ON THE MOTION THAT WHEN THE HOUSE ADJOURN  TODAY IT MEET ON NEXT FRIDAY.  (P. 467-1)

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H. RES. 41, PROVIDING THAT THE COMMITTEE ON POST OFFICE AND POST ROADS BE AUTHORIZED TO REQUEST THE POSTMASTER GENERAL TO SEND TO THE COMMITTEE ALL PAPERS IN CONNECTION WITH THE RECENT INVESTIGATION OF HIS DEPARTMENT.  (P. 51-2 53-1)

TO RECOMMIT H. RES. 41, A RESOLUTION AUTHORIZING THE COMMITTEE ON POST OFFICES AND POST ROADS TO REQUEST PAPERS RELATIVE TO AN INVESTIGATION OF HIS DEPARTMENT FROM THE POSTMASTER-GENERAL WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO AMEND SO THAT THE POSTMASTER-GENERAL IS DIRECTLY REQUESTED, IN LIEU OF THE PHRASING AUTHORIZING THE COMMITTEE TO REQUEST SAID PAPERS.  (P. 54-2)

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H.RES. 76, PROVIDING THAT THE COMMITTEE ON EXPENDITURES IN THE POST OFFICE DEPARTMENT IS HEREBY AUTHORIZED TO REQUEST THE POSTMASTER-GENERAL TO SEND TO THE COMMITTEE ALL PAPERS CONNECTED WITH THE RECENT INVESTIGATION OF HIS DEPARTMENT. (P. 380-2 385-2) (NOTE.-JOURNAL SHOWS SPEAKER VOTING IN AFFIRMATIVE TO MAKE A TIE.

TO PASS H. RES. 76, PROVIDING THAT THE COMMITTEE ON EXPENDITURES IN THE POST OFFICE DEPARTMENT IS HEREBY AUTHORIZED TO REQUEST THE POSTMASTER-GENERAL TO SEND THEM ALL PAPERS RELATING TO THE RECENT INVESTIGATION OF HIS DEPARTMENT.  (P. 380-2 385-2)

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H. RES. 118, PROVIDING THAT COMMITTEE BE APPOINTED TO INVESTIGATE CHARGES OF IREGULARITIES AND FRAUDS IN THE REPORT OF 4TH ASSISTANT POSTMASTER-GENERAL.  NO QUORUM VOTING. (P. 444-2 445-1 448-2)
TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H. RES. 118. (P. 444-2 445-1 448-2)
TO RECOMMIT H. RES. 118 TO THE COMMITTEE ON POST OFFICES AND POST ROADS.  (P. 476-1, 444-2, 445-1)

TO AMEND H.R. 9480 (33 STAT 85, 3/18/1904), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE LEGISLATIVE, EXECUTIVE AND JUDICIAL EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR FISCAL 1905, BY PROVIDING TO ELIMINATE FROM THE CIVIL SERVICE COMMISSION AN APPROPRIATION FOR SALARIES OF EMPLOYEES, AND AN APPROPRIATION FOR NECESSARY TRAVELING EXPENSES, INCLUDING THOSE OF EXAMINERS ACTING UNDER THE DIRECTION OF THE COMMISSION, AND FOR EXPENSES OF EXAMINATION AND INVESTIGATION HELD ELSEWHERE THAN AT WASHINGTON.  (P. 782-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 6295, A BILL FOR PREVENTING THE ADULTERATION, MISBRANDING AND IMITATION OF FOODS, BEVERAGES, CANDIES, DRUGS DRUGS AND CONDIMINTS IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, AND THE TERRITORIES, AND FOR REGULATING INTERSTATE TRAFFIC, BY PROVIDING THAT ANY ARTICLE OF FOOD OR DRUGS ADULTERATED OR MISBRANDED WITHIN THE MEANING OF THIS ACT, IS PROHIBITED, AND ANY PERSON INTRODUCING SUCH AN ARTICLE SHALL BE PROSECUTED OR FINED FOR FIRST OFFENSE $200, AND $300 FOR THE SECOND OFFENSE, OR ONE YEAR IMPRISONMENT, OR BOTH. (P. 938-2)

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON A SUBSTITUTE FOR H. RES. 150, A RESOLUTION REQUESTING THE SECRETARY OF STATE TO FURNISH THE HOUSE WITH A STATEMENT SHOWING THE NUMBER OF HORSES, CARRIAGES AND AUTOMOBILES MAINTAINED AT GOVERNMENT EXPENSE FOR THE USE OF HIS DEPARTMENT, WHICH SUBSTITUTE RESOLUTION PROVIDES THAT SAID STATEMENT SHALL ALSO INCLUDE THE COST OF HORSES, CARRIAGES AND AUTOMOBILES.  (P. 1138-2)

TO AMEND H. RES. 195, RESOLVING THAT HON. GEORGE HOWELL WAS NOT ELECTED, AND HON. WILLIAM CONNELL WAS ELECTED AS REPRESENTATIVE IN THE 58TH CONGRESS FROM THE 10TH DISTRICT OF THE STATE OF PENNSYLVANIA, BY PROVIDING TO ELIMINATE THE NAME OF MR. WILLIAM CONNELL AS BEING DULY ELECTED AND SUBSTITUTE THEREFOR THE NAME OF MR. HOWELL. (P. 1865-1, 1783-2)
TO PASS THE FIRST SECTION OF H. RES. 195.  (P. 1234-1)
TO PASS THE 2ND SECTION OF THE H. RES. 195.  (P. 1234-1)

TO AMEND H.R. 10954 (33 STAT-15, FEB. 18, 1904), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO SUPPLY URGENT DEFICIENCIES IN THE APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL 1904, BY AGREEING TO THE SENATE AMENDMENT APPROPRIATING $4,600,000 TO AID IN THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE LOUISIANA PURCHASE EXPOSITION, BUT TO ELIMINATE THE 0TIPULATION REQUIRING THE LOUISIANA PURCHASE EXPOSITION COMPANY TO PAY TO THE GOVERMENT 40% OF THEIR GROSS RECEIPT MONTHLY AND ARRANGE TO LIQUIDATE THIS LOAN AT THE CLOSING OF THE EXPOSITION.  (P. 1739-1,2 1738-2) NOTE: SEE PAGES 1738, 1739 OF RECORD FOR COMPLETE DETAIL.
TO ADJOURN ON WASHINGTON'S BIRTHDAY.  (P. 2208-2)
TO RECOMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE ON NAVAL AFFAIRS, HR. 12220, (33 STAT-324, APRIL 27, 1904), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE NAVAL SERVICE FOR FISCAL 1905.  (P. 2449-1)

TO TABLE THE APPEAL OF MR. GRIGGS FROM THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR, MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF H. RES. 118, PROVIDING FOR A COMMITTEE OF THE HOUSE TO INVESTIGATE CHARGES IN RELATION TO THE CONDUCT OF THE POST OFFICE, CHAIR  HOLDING THAT THE LINKING TOGETHER OF PRIVILEGED AND NON-PRIVILEGED MATTERS IS PROHIBITED.  (P. 3146)

TO RECOMMIT H. RES. 118, PROVIDING FOR A COMMITTEE OF THE HOUSE TO INVESTIGATE CHARGES IN RELATION TO THE CONDUCT OF THE POST-OFFICE DEPARTMENT, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO RECOMMIT THE PENDING REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON POST OFFICES AND POST ROADS TO A SELECT COMMITTEE, SAID COMMITTEE BEING DIRECTED TO CONSIDER THE REPORT, PAPERS, AND COMMUNICATION, SO FAR AS THEY RELATE TO THE MEMBERS AND TO HEAR ANY OFFICIAL OF THE POST OFFICE DEPARTMENT REGARDING MATTERS PERTAINING TO MEMBERS OF THE HOUSE. (P. 3146-1 3151-1 3150-2)

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H. RES. 260, PROVIDING TO EXPUNGE FROM THE CONGRESSIONAL RECORD CERTAIN REMARKS OF HON. ROBERT BAKER OF NEW YORK, AS THESE REMARKS WERE CHARGES AGAINST A MEMBER OF THE HOUSE AND WERE NOT IN ORDER.

TO RECOMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE ON POST OFFICES AND POST ROADS, H.R. (33 STAT-429, APRIL 28, 1904), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE POST OFFICE DEPARTMENT FOR FISCAL 1905, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO ELIMINATE APPROPRIATION FOR NECESSARY AND SPECIAL FACILITIES ON TRUCK LINES FROM WASHINGTON TO ATLANTA AND NEW ORLEANS, AND ALSO FOR NECESSARY AND SPECIAL FACILITIES ON TRUCK LINES FROM KANSAS CITY, MO., TO NEWTON, KAN.  (P.3730-1)

TO RECOMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE ON APPROPRIATIONS, H.R. 14416, (33 STAT-452, APRIL 28, 1904), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR SUNDRY CIVIL EXPENSES  OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR FISCAL 1905, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO ELIMINATE AN APPROPRIATION FOR RENTAL OF OLD CUSTOM-HOUSE TO SERVE AS TEMPORARY QUARTERS FOR THE ACCOMODATIONS OF CERTAIN GOVERNMENT OFFICIAL AT NEW YORK CITY, NO QUORUM VOTING.  (P. 4075-2)

TO RECOMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE ON APPROPRIATIONS, H.R. 14416 (33 STAT 452, 4/28/1904), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR SUNDRY CIVIL EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1905, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO ELIMINATE AN APPROPRIATION FOR RENT OF OLD CUSTOM-HOUSE TO SERVE AS TEMPORARY QUARTERS FOR THE ACCOMODATIONS OF CERTAIN GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS AT NEW YORK CITY.  (P. 4075)

TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN THE SENATE AMENDMENT NO. 16 TO H.R. 10670 (33 STAT-259, APP. APRIL 23, 1904, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE ARMY FOR FISCAL 1905, WHICH SENATE AMENDMENT INCREASES THE SIGNAL CORPS OF THE ARMY, WITH AN AMENDMENT TO THAT AMENDMENT INCREASING THE APPROPRIATION THEREIN.  (P. 4112-2)

TO SUSPEND RULES AND AGREE TO AMENDMENT AS A SUBSTITUTE FOR S. 276 (33 STAT 175, APRIL 23, 1904), PROVIDING FOR THE CELEBRATION OF THE ONE HUNDREDTH ANNIVERSARY OF THE EXPLORATION OF THE OREGON COUNTRY BY LEWIS AND CLARK; THE SUBSTITUTE AMENDMENT ELIMINATING ALL AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE, AND IN LIEU THEREOF, SPECIFYING GOVERNMENTAL PRACTICIPATION IN THE EXPOSITION, BY THE ERECTION OF AN EXHIBIT AND APPROPRIATING FUNDS FOR THAT PURPOSE.

TO SUSPEND RULES AND PASS A RESOLUTION RELATING TO S. 276, REGARDING THE ANNIVERSARY OF LEWIS AND CLARK EXPEDITION, WHICH RESOLUTION PROVIDES THAT FOR THE REMAINDER OF THIS SESSION S. 276 SHALL HAVE THE PRIVILEGES PERTAINING TO BILLS REPORTED BY COMMITTEES HAVING LEAVE TO REPORT AT ANY TIME.

TO RECEDE AND AND CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT NUMBER 49, TO H.R. 10670, (33 STAT-259, APRIL 23, 1904), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE ARMY FOR FISCAL 1905, WHICH AMENDMENT APPROPRIATES $250,000 FOR CONTINUING THE CONSTRUCTION OF A MILITARY WAGON ROAD.  (P. 4434-2)
TO PASS H. RES. 309, ORDER FOR CONSIDERATION OF S. 2259, REGULATING SHIPPING BETWEEN PORTS OF THE UNITED STATES AND PORTS OR PLACES IN THE PHILIPPINE ARCHIPELAGO.  (P. 4440-1)

TO AMEND S. 2259, A BILL REGULATING SHIPPING, IN TRADE BETWEEN PORTS OF THE UNITED STATES AND PORTS OR PLACES IN THE PHILIPPINE ARCHIPELAGO, BY PROVIDING TO EXTEND THE TIME FROM JULY 1, 1906 TO JULY 1, 1909, FOR THE ADJUSTMENT OF THE SHIPPING TRAFFIC BY THE ESTABLISHMENT OF NEW LINES AND PROGRESSING IN THE PREPARATION FOR A COMPLETE CONTROL OF THAT BUSINESS.  (P. 4499-2 4500-1)

TO TABLE H. RES. 278, INQUIRING IF SERVICE VETERANS OF THE UNITED STATES WHO SERVED DURING THE WAR OF THE REBELLION, AND WHO HAVE REACHED THE AGE OF 62 YEARS, SHALL BE ENTITLED TO A PENSION.  (P. 457-2 4589-2)

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H. RES. 319, ORDER FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 14623, AMENDING AN ACT TO PROVIDE TEMPORARILY FOR CIVIL GOVERNMENT AFFAIRS IN THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS, TO PROVIDE FOR REVENUE, A COINAGE SYSTEM, AND FOR MORE EFFICIENT ADMINISTRATION OF THE CIVIL GOVERNMENT.

TO PASS H. RES. 319, ORDER FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 14623, AMENDING AN ACT APPROVED JULY 1, 1902, ARRANGING TO PROVIDE TEMPORARILY FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE CIVIL GOVERNMENT OF THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS.

TO PASS H.R. 14623, A BILL AMENDING AN ACT TO PROVIDE TEMPORARILY FOR CIVIL GOVERNMENT AFFAIRS IN THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS, TO PROVIDE FOR REVENUE, A COINAGE SYSTEM, AND FOR MORE EFFICIENT ADMINISTRATION OF THE CIVIL GOVERNMENT.

TO AMEND H.R. 4483, (33 STAT-314, APRIL 27, 1904), A BILL DECLARING THE TUNNELS UNDER THE CHICAGO RIVER AN OBSTRUCTION TO NAVIGATION, BY SPECIFYING THAT THIS LAW SHALL TAKE EFFECT ON JULY 1, 1906, THIS BEING THE EXPIRATION DATE OF THE CONTRACT BETWEEN THE UNION TRACTION COMPANY AND THE CITY OF CHICAGO. TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN THE SENATE AMENDMENT NUMBER 18 TO H.R. 12220, (33 STAT-324, APRIL 27, 1904), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE NAVAL SERVICE FOR FISCAL 1905, WHICH SENATE AMENDMENT RELATES TO A NAVAL TRAINING STATION AT GREAT LAKES, AND AMEND THIS AMENDMENT BY PROVIDING THAT THE SITE FOR SAID NAVAL TRAINING STATION SHALL BE SELECTED BY THE SECRETARY OF THE NAVY, BUT HE SHALL NOT PAY A SUM TO EXCEED $250 PER ACRE.  (P. 5188-1)

TO PASS H. RES. 282, PROVIDING THAT AT ANY TIME DURING THE REMAINDER OF THIS SESSION, THE BILL H.R. 7056, CREATING A COMMISSION TO CONSIDER AND RECOMMEND LEGISLATION FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE AMERICAN MERCHANT MARINE, MAY BE CONSIDERED IN THE HOUSE AS IN THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE. (P. 5255-1)

TO AMEND H.R. 17473, (33 STAT-827, MAR. 2, 1905), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE ARMY FOR FISCAL 1906, BY PROVIDING THAT HEREAFTER NO RETIRED OFFICERS OF THE ARMY ABOVE THE GRADE OF MAJOR, SHALL, WHEN ASSIGNED TO ACTIVE DUTY, RECEIVE FROM THE UNITED STATE ANY PAY OR ALLOWANCES ADDITIONAL TO HIS PAY AS A RETIRED OFFICER, SO AS TO MAKE HIS TOTAL PAY AND ALLOWANCES EXCEED THE PAY AND ALLOWANCES OF MAJOR ON THE ACTIVE LIST. RES. 503, PROVIDING THAT THE SENATE AMENDMENT NO. 208 TO THE AGRICULTURAL APPROPRIATION BILL, H.R. 18329, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT PARAGRAPH 234, THE REVENUE ACT OF JULY 24, 1897, PROVIDING FOR A DUTY ON INPORTED WHEAT AND A DRAWBACK, SHALL NOT BE HELD EFFECTIVE BY THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 30 OF H.R. 18329, INFRINGES THE CONSTITUTIONAL PRIVILEGES OF THE HOUSE AND THAT SAID AMENDMENT BE RETURNED TO THE SENATE WITH THIS RESOLUTION.
